operating_mode: AD7980 CS Mode and Chain Mode

causality.effect: Conversion data becomes available on SDO
causality.condition: Within t_CONV time. The first bit is driven on SDO upon CNV or SDI falling edge (t_EN).

causality.effect: Next bit of SDO data becomes valid

causality.condition: Data is guaranteed to be stable for a minimum duration of t_HSDO.

causality.effect: SDO drives the D15 MSB bit
causality.condition: Occurs after t_EN delay in CS Mode.

causality.trigger: CNV or SDI goes High, or the last SCK falling edge occurs
causality.effect: SDO output enters a High-Impedance state
causality.condition: Occurs after t_DIS delay in CS Mode.
Propagation delay of t_DSDOSDI, applies in Chain Mode with Busy Indicator.

t_CONV.description: Conversion Time: CNV Rising Edge to Data Available

t_SSDICNV_CS_Mode.description: SDI Valid Setup Time from CNV Rising Edge (CS Mode)

t_HSDICNV_CS_Mode.description: SDI Valid Hold Time from CNV Rising Edge (CS Mode)

t_HSDICNV_Chain_Mode.description: SDI Valid Hold Time from CNV Rising Edge (Chain Mode)

t_SSCKCNV_Chain_Mode.description: SCK Valid Setup Time from CNV Rising Edge (Chain Mode)

t_HSCKCNV_Chain_Mode.description: SCK Valid Hold Time from CNV Rising Edge (Chain Mode)

t_SSDISCK_Chain_Mode.description: SDI Valid Setup Time from SCK Falling Edge (Chain Mode)

t_HSDISCK_Chain_Mode.description: SDI Valid Hold Time from SCK Falling Edge (Chain Mode)

states.description: The SDO output pin is tri-stated. This occurs after a read operation is complete in CS Mode, triggered by CNV high, SDI high, or the last SCK falling edge.
Chip Select mode where the CNV signal frames the conversion and data transfer.
A mode that allows multiple devices to be daisy-chained together. Data from one device's SDO is passed to the next device's SDI.
A feature within Chain Mode where the SDO pin is used to indicate the converter's busy status.
